name: Proof Carrying Code
description: scaling up the idea of Proof Carrying Code to real programming languages, using a logic encoded in Twelf's dependent type system.

name: The SeLF Project
description: encodings of security policies and proofs of security properties for the Grey project.

name: Mechanizing the Metatheory of Standard ML
description: a formalization of Standard ML and verification of its metatheory in Twelf.

name: LATIN
description: a project aimed at the creation of a large library of logics and logic translations supported by a web-scalable infrastructure

name: Dependent Types for ML
description: A paper by Dan Licata and Bob Harper about enriching an ML-like type system with a form of dependent types.  Much of the metatheory of the language is mechanized in Twelf.

name: Substructural Languages
description: Twelf code from some of Matthew Fluet's papers on substructural languages.

name: Self-Adjusting Computation
description: Jake Donham's formalization of a consistency proof of non-deterministic semantics.

name: Elaborating Intersection and Union Types
description: Joshua Dunfield's proofs about an elaboration semantics.
